page.title: 09Farming near E. Hagbourne
page.content: There are many farms in the area, most are arable with some mixed or fruit farms. Most dairying takes place on the drained marshland round Hacca Brook. Near the settlements, fruit farms are found eg J W Corderoy at Hagbourne Mill Farm, East Hagbourne, operates a PYO and ready picked system and grows a variety of produce- strawberries, raspberries, asparagus and flowers. Some of the farming land is used for rearing horses and there are racing stables at Aston Upthorpe together with a stud farm. Upthorpe Farm is 500 acres with a cropping acreage of 250. There are 5 full time staff and 3 part timers. It is an arable and dairy farm producing milk and wheat/barley. Fertilisers used include Â£slyde' and Â£raddar' for arable crops and Â£chafer' and Â£nitram' on the grassland.
